title-part.text: SEVERING BY MEANS OTHER THAN CUTTING

reference.text: marking-out, perforating or making buttonholes A41H25/00; shoemaking A43D; surgery A61B; punching metal B21D; drilling metal B23B; cutting of metal by applying heat locally, e.g. flame cutting, B23K; cutting by abrasive fluid jets B24C5/02; details common to machines for severing B26D; drilling wood B27C; drilling stone B28D; working of plastics or substances in a plastic state B29; making boxes, cartons, envelopes or bags, of paper or similarly worked materials, e.g. metal foil, B31B; of glass C03B; of leather C14B; of textile materials D06H; for light guides G02B6/25; of tickets G07B

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers: perforating, punching, cutting-out, stamping-out;severing, by means other than cutting, non-metallic sheet materials or metal foil in general;severing, by means other than cutting, other forms of non-metallic material not otherwise provided for.
Attention is drawn to Notes (1) and (2) following the title of subclass B26D.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: subbjecting the grinding tools or the abrading medium to vibration, e.g. grinding with ultrasonic frequency B24B1/04, perforating by sand-blasting B24C;

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. abrasive blasting used for cutting B24C1/045

reference.text: ; punching cards or tapes for statistical and record purposes G06K1/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Perforation of photographic films
specially adapted for perforating tubes
by rotary tools, e.g. saws
of the drill type
from the inside
by tools that follow a closed path around the tube
by machining, e.g. cutting, grinding, projections on the tube wall
whereby the tube moves axially or radially
and the tool travels with the tube
and the tool rotates
specially adapted for perforating rubber

title-part.text: Perforating by punching, e.g. with relatively-reciprocating punch and bed

wherein the tools are carried by, and in operation move relative to, a rotative drum or similar support

CPC-specific-text.text: by flow drilling

title-part.text: Perforating by slitting, i.e. forming cuts closed at their ends without removal of material
with tools carried by a rotating drum or similar support
to form non-rectilinear cuts, e.g. for tabs

reference.text: details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed B25F5/00

CPC-specific-text.text: hand held pliers with handles
wherein relative movements of tool head and work during cutting have a component tangential to the work surface
wherein the tool head is moved in a plane parallel to the work in a coordinate system fixed with respect to the work
wherein the cutting member reciprocates in, or substantially in, a direction parallel to the cutting edge
using a rotary circular cutting member
using an endless band-knife or the like
using rotating drums
cutting out discs or the like

reference.text: B26F1/384, B26F1/40 and B26F1/44 take precedence
